Key Match Events: Bahrain’s goals came through Mohamed Marhoon in the 15th minute and 90+8'
The Indonesian national team scored through Ragnar Oratmangoen in the 45+2nd minute and Rafael Struick 74'
Referee Ahmed Al Kaf’s controversial decision at the end of the match ruined the Indonesian national team‘s victory
The referee from Oman gave six minutes of extra time in the second half, but instead, the match was allowed to end for nine minutes
Bahrain was able to equalize in the 90+9th minute
Indonesian national team manager, Sumardji, received a red card from the referee for protesting too loudly
Post-Match Reflections: Indonesian national team coach Shin Tae-yong expressed disappointment about referee Ahmed Al Kaf’s leadership during the match
Shin Tae-yong called the referee’s decision in this match biased, which caused the Indonesian national team players to express anger at the end of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indonesia received an additional 4.39 points in the FIFA ranking but remained in 129th position
Bahrain experienced a significant decline in FIFA’s ranking, dropping to 78th after losing 4.39 points
Others: Referee Ahmed Al Kaf issued three yellow cards in the match, one for Bahrain and two for Indonesia
Al Kaf fouled Indonesia 27 times, one of which led to a free kick that gave Bahrain the lead in the 15th minute
